intro: Rhinanthus pulcher, commonly known as the beautiful yellow-rattle, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots form a symbiotic relationship with certain fungi, aiding in nutrient absorption. Rhinanthus pulcher thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
